result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Tyrone Bowling in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Tyrone Bowling.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a jury trial. State is requesting an adjournment due to victim not being available today.  Defense moves to dismiss.  Court granted State's motion to adjourn.  Case is adjourned to 12-14-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.
Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrone Bowling in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 9-28-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Tyrone Bowling in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tyrone Bowling in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant appears by zoom.  Case in court for an inital appearance. Defendant was to appear in person.  Case is adjourned to 5-6-22 at 2:30 pm for an initial appearance in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
